text: Well, as much as I'd, uh, I'd like to say that I'll be looking for a flashy convertible or, uh, or a four by four or something,  /
I guess the next car I'll be looking for is a kind of a plain old four door <laughter>. /
<Laughter>  What kind of a car do you have now? /
Oh, we've got a, uh, an older Delta Eighty-Eight,  /
and then, uh, our, our newer car is a, uh, a Corsica. /
And we'll probably be looking for something about that, uh, that same style. /
That same kind of four door, hard top style. /
So, uh, in fact, uh, our Oldsmobile is a, is a like an old Delta Eighty-Eight  /
but it's in pretty good sh-, in really good shape. /
And we've been really pleased with Oldsmobiles. /
So that's probably where the first place we'd look. /
Well, we've always had, uh, Fords. /

Um, but, yeah, we're, we're in the same shape.  /
I think our next car will be a, you know, some big old four door, uh, something that can haul the kids to baseball practice --
well I used to drive an Escort,  /

And, uh, and this Escort took it all.  /

but it only had thirty-four thousand miles on it when I bought it. /
And I just, you know, I just drive it to work.  /

So, uh, it <laughter> doesn't get much of, uh, - /

and it's a four door which is nice, /

they, uh, the ones that have, uh, families, uh,  /
and they still want kind of a sports car.  /

and usually they're in like black,
and gun metal grey and those kind of colors.  /

until, until you look at the price tag  /

I went, I went through that when I first got out of, uh, college.  /
I had an old car that I bought just to get to, to my j-, my first job. /
And when I got there, the first thing I did was trade it in on a Spitfire. /
#And# I, I knew that was going to be the only time I could afford a  two seater, uh, sports car. /
But that, that just does not make it as an only car. /
It's, uh, it's like I, I would, - /
I bought a set of stereo speakers -- /
-- and it was one of those cash and carry deals.  /
I had to take them one at  a time,
And it was winter, so I was in like this coat --
and the speaker in the passenger seat. /
And I drove that one home,  /
and then I went back and got the other one and put that in the,
passenger seat and drove that one home.  /
And da-, you kind of outgrow that real quick --
Most people that I've talked to did stuff like that when they were in college,
or, you know, or when they were single anyway. /
They'd, they'd buy themselves a sporty car because it was their last.  /
Uh, you know, my first car was a Toyota Corolla. /

-- and, uh, that was a great little car.  /
that's how I met girls was, I'd find out if a girl could drive a manual transmission, which I, I had never, - /

it worked all right, real good. /

she really doesn't want to learn I guess,

And we went, uh, <children> we went, uh, we went to a dealership  /
and, uh, it, it was prev-, she, she did pretty well.  /

it was a Le Baron with everything on it, /
but it had a standard shift.  /

in fact all our earlier cars were a standard transmission.  /

this Dodge Aries is the first car we've ever gotten that had anything.  /

Well, I guess that's, I guess that's about all I've got to say,
the, the thing about this, uh, th-, - /
I will say this about the minivan. /
We thought that was a luxury car when we bought it. /
We never had it, you know,  /
we always had the A M radio. /
And, uh, of course this has, this (( )) that had s-, speakers that you can control from the back seat. /
And you can change the channels on the, on the radio from the back seat too <Door>. /

but I bet on the next time you buy a car, that's going to be mandatory. /
You've got to have that now. /
and you got to have it. /
